tag_list: android, motorola, smartphones, motoblur, product-management, social-media, good-technology, symbian, droid, droidx, nokia, nokia-e71, business-impact, ces, flipout, dext, computer-science
overview:
Reena Nadkarni is Senior Partner Technology Manager in Google’s mobile commerce group. She manages partnerships for Google Wallet. Reena also serves as a commissioner on the Technology, Information and Communications Committee for the City of Cupertino.

Previously Reena was Director of Product Management at Motorola, Inc. where she focused on social networking and personal information management (PIM) on Motorola’s Android line of Smartphones including DROIDX, FLIPOUT, CLIQ, DEXT. Prior to that Reena worked at Good Technology where she managed Good’s international product strategy and enterprise email product line for Symbian products such as the Nokia E71. Reena has an MBA in corporate strategy and marketing from University of Michigan, Ann Arbor.

Prior to entering the product management domain, Reena has a technical background. She has a computer engineering degree from Pune Institute of Computer Technology, India and a Master’s in Computer Science from State University of New York, Stony Brook. She started her career as a Software Design Engineer at Microsoft in Redmond, WA.

Awards and Conferences:
Reena has represented Motorola’s digital accessories team at CES and Compuware Corp at the VsLive conference in San Francisco. Reena is the 2008 recipient of Strategic Business Impact Award from Motorola Women’s Business Council.
